instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.KERNEL_TASK: What is KERNEL_TASK? KERNEL_TASK is a process that will take up all the CPU and cause the macbook to run very slow when there is a sensor issue. When you see KERNEL_TASK as a process taking up lots of CPU and the machine is working very slow or has loud fans, use a program like hwmonitor to check voltage, amperage, and temperature sensors and look for something that doesnâ€™t look right..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes on battery, on charger all fine
threads.message:
Client had repaired liquid damage in some other shop.
They replaced battery and on the board I can see liquid damage around:
UB600, J5260, QV300, UB300

When on battery there are random restarts with kernel panic.
"*** Panic Report ***
panic(cpu 0 caller 0xffffff801f342836): nvme: "AppleS3XController. Loss of MMIO space. Write. ID=0xffffffff ARG1=0xffffffff ARG2=0xffffffff ARG3=0xffffffff EDD0=0xffffffff EDD1=0xffffffff EDD2=0xffffffff EDD3=0xffffffff EDD4=0xffffffff EDD5=0xffffffff EDD6=0xffffffff EDD7=0xffffffff NANDV=0x2, DRAMV=0x1, SSDC=256G.\n" @IONVMeController.cpp:6053
Panicked task 0xffffff854c2516a0: 188 threads: pid 0: <SIGNAL>KERNEL_TASK</SIGNAL>"

When on charger then all works fine even during CPU stress test.

Tried with know battery and got the same issue.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes on battery, on charger all fine
threads.message:
Any error pops up starting in diagnostic mode (battery connected)?
The best option is testing with known good ORIGINAL battery (even old one).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes on battery, on charger all fine
threads.message:
No error in diagnostic mode (battery connected).

Tested with original used battery and same issue.

One thing which is not right and dont know if it will be related:
J3300/47 <SIGNAL>USBC_XA_D2R_P</SIGNAL><2>in diode mode 0.004 and should be around 0.330

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes on battery, on charger all fine
threads.message:
<DIODE>D3326</DIODE> is the first suspect; remove it and check again.
If still short, bad <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.
